main event: Multiple witnesses observed 12 unidentified flying objects in Middletown, Ohio on October 1, 1966.
interesting points: The objects were reported in varying numbers throughout the observation, with one estimate placing them at about 31., Observers described the objects as bright, larger than a star, with a light bulb-like brightness., Witnesses reported that the objects moved in different directions and sometimes disappeared behind clouds., The duration of the observations varied, with at least one lasting for up to 30 minutes., The sighting occurred during a clear night, contributing to the visibility of the objects.
witness description: Individuals aged 11 and 15 who observed the objects.
